This is the 3rd time I'm here.

review_text: We very much enjoyed Gail and Jonâ€™s hospitality during our stay. We spent time hiking the local state park and visiting some restaurants in Littleton and Halifax, North Carolina. Really enjoyed living on a farm for a few days, and the hosts both took time to explain all the features and functionality of the facility. We were impressed with the large group fire pit area along with covered seating, ice maker and cooking facilities nearby. The farm was nicely decorated for Christmas and bathroom facilities were warm and cozy, including lots of toiletry supplies in case you forgot to bring yours. John and Gail have a wonderful home made artisan shop that we took advantage of â€“ purchased some necklaces for the kids and a cutting board for home. We enjoyed lots of good conversation and felt right at home in this cozy beautiful cabin, with comfortable furniture and reliable light and heat. Heard Owls too. We will definitely visit again, and encourage others to do the same! Seasons, greetings!

If you stay here definitely ask for the farm tour, there is a $45 fee for a one hour overview of the homesteadâ€¦ worth it! I learned about rain water harvesting, gardening, growing meat rabbits and canningâ€¦ even how to store canned goods!
The little farm store is a must! Definitely stop in and buy the pain balm. Everything is made by Gail and inexpensive.
Overall this place is a super unique, educational, clean airbnb! I just wish I could have stayed longer. Next time I will definitely utilize the fire pit and Iâ€™m taking an art class with Gail (the host!) she is a brilliant artist!
Thank you Gail and John! We will be back!

We were all a little sad to leave. This was a trip to remember and we are already thinking about when we can visit next! Thank you to the hosts for always responding promptly to our questions. They made sure every need was met.

review_text: We had a great stay! It was, by far, our favorite Airbnb rental so far. Youâ€™ll have everything you need and more while staying at this quiet lake house with a view. The home is clean and is decorated with a nice lake/outdoorsy theme. Amenities above and beyond are provided - we really loved all the decking, grill, washer and dryer (lol), kayaks, extra bedding, and stocked kitchen. The location is secluded, peaceful, and has a fantastic lake view. We saw (and heard) a huge variety of birds - an osprey even hung out on the swing bench. FYI: to get to the dock there is a dirt/gravel path and then wooden stairs. The dock area can get very sunny, so be prepared (hats, sunblock). There is a Food Lion grocery store about 12 minutes away for any necessities. If youâ€™re deciding on whether or not to stay here - do it! You wonâ€™t regret it (youâ€™ll love it!).

We GREATLY enjoyed our stay at the Weekend Hooker! Sam and Jeremyâ€™s lake home was both clean and simple. We didnâ€™t need to look for things, had everything we needed, and nothing that we didnâ€™t need. No clutter was very relaxing!
We loved that the beds were made up and ready for us, the bathrooms were well stocked with clean towels; washcloths, and toilet paper, and we enjoyed full access to the deck, grill, and dock.
Sam and Jeremy answered every message and question very quickly, thoroughly, and with excitement. Their guide within the Airbnb app gave great information about the local region as well.
We see why Sam and Jeremy are super hosts! We truly had a very relaxing and comfortable week enjoying swimming in the lake, fishing from the dock and from our boat which we were able to keep on their dock, relaxing in the swing, grilling on the deck, and playing cards. While there was a TV and DVD available we didnâ€™t even need to turn it on. What a great first Airbnb experience for us . We highly recommend Weekend Hooker and plan on returning!

review_text:
We enjoyed the stay at The Weekend Hooker very much. My family is six (and our dog) came here to celebrate my mother's 81st birthday.
The fire pit, decks and grill were such a pleasure for us! The overhanging trees made us feel quite secluded. The little touches of having dog treats, human treats and games was great. The indoor gas fireplace was more than ample heat and lovely to look at. While chatting by the fire, we played a game of "how many ducks are in this room" based on the decor (spoiler alert, it's 87).
A couple of things to note, as is clear in the description and photos: the bedroom is an upper loft with two queen beds and a circular staircase to the first floor (mom happily slept on the couch). The walk to the water is a lovely 200 steps. We knew mom wouldn't be able to do it, but the rest of us were fine (and more fit when we left than when we arrived, haha).
It was a great trip, we had the best communication with the host that we've ever had with Airbnb. looking forward to returning!

review_text: This home and location has everything you need for a relaxing and memorable getaway. Literally everything we needed and wanted was right there, so we never even left the property during our 4 night stay except for walks along the road with our pooch. Based on the beautiful pictures online, we had packed food in case we decided to eat in, and Samantha and Jeremy had breakfast snacks and plenty of coffee - the one thing I had forgotten. Communication was fast and pleasant from booking to checking out, and they have created a wonderful getaway, even providing everything the dog needed too. They are SUPERHOSTS in every sense of the word, and we are so happy to have found their place. The mattresses were comfortable and shower had good pressure - 2 very nice details you don't always get or expect. The views from the decks and the dock were so serene and peaceful, we spent most of our time outside soaking it all in. One of the most enjoyable and restorative vacations we've had in a long time!

They provided detailed info about the house and our stay, but answered any questions we had quickly. The house itself was super cute, and had more than enough space for our party of 4 (plus 2 doggies). We had great weather, so we spent way more time on the home's 2 story deck, than actually in the home, but that's just another plus! The loft has a deck off of it that made sleeping with the door open (screen door shut!), so much more comfortable given the breeze. The view from both of the decks was beautiful and the space was very private. Waterfront, with a huge dock that we were able to spread out on. There honestly isn't anything negative to say about this home, and we'd definitely return!

This place is just as the pictures describe-- a beautiful lake view from a fabulous series of decks offering a great outdoor space, including a fire pit and hike down to the dock. Your hosts are super attentive and want you to enjoy your stay- there are lots of good recommendations of things to do and see. We hiked in Medoc Mountain State Park and the Roanoke Rapids Trail, in addition to driving to historic Halifax and venturing out onto the lake in the canoe and kayaks.

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: This is a gem of a house in a gem of an historic town. The Halifax Resolves, a precursor to the Declaration of Independence, were adopted here. There are lots of nicely restored historic buildings and some beauties just waiting to be taken on as a project. Glenn has created a very welcoming space with lots of nice touches, such as antiques, the table set for a meal, a new bag of coffee next to the coffee maker and a fresh sponge next to the sink. The backyard is very large and our dog loved it. The were thrilled the house still has the feel of a vintage property. It is all on one level and easy to access. The floors are a little uneven, as might be expected, but could be an issue for some. N.B. If I had read the listing more carefully, I might have realized there is no stove. There is a microwave and toaster oven, as well as a slow cooker. We were only there for one night, but we enjoyed a couple of walks around the town. Glenn is a very responsive host. We hope to be back one day.

Rating, 2 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
*Communication is terrible*
Very little responses after you book. After that you're on your own.
Instructions on how to get in the house were not on air bnb and I had to ask..
Because i came from NY late i didn't have a tour or anything but that was not an issue at all. Its pretty much self-explanatory inside.
Cold water didn't work and wasn't fixed until days after I got there. Not a big deal but I had to buy bottled water to drink.
This place is nice. However, its in the middle of nowhere and meant for short stays given the location.
* I felt like I was living in the country ghetto.*
The red couch had multiple springs that were stabbing me.. they need to throw that thing out and get a new one.
** They have a mandatory cleaning service WEEKLY.** Someone comes in and cleans or whatever. I didn't get any response on the details and I asked if that was necessary and he said yes because he already paid her. I asked if she could come there when im off work since I only work 3 days a week. NO response... i don't want someone touching my personal belongings or washing my 300$ comforter that can't be machine washed..
I ended up leaving my reservation early due to work circumstances. So I still don't know what exactly the cleaner does when she cleans. I didnt get clear instructions on what she does. Trash removal? Vacuuming? I just don't know what else she would be doing. I think its unnecessary and uncomfortable when I can't lock my things up when she's there.
**In a nut shell.. this was the worst airbnb I've ever been to and worse communication by far. **

review_text:
The place is lovely and we loved it. Nothing around unless you drive about 15 minutes, so come prepared. We were happy to see that because that is what we were looking for. Peace and calm with privacy for our doggie kids. There are plenty of activities to do at the house.
The hosts never answered any of our messages, even asking about the surprise fish in the house plant bowl, but luckily we never needed anything major. Once we realized they did not respond we did not send any more communication except letting them know when we checked out.
Mobility Awareness: There is no clear path leading from the back pad area to the grass yard through the rocks. Steady yourself or get a hand to help you over them. They can shift and be slick.

Of all the Airbnb properties I've ever visited, THIS BY FAR, is NUMBER ONE! I just couldn't stop extending our stay! We really did not want to leave! After checking out, we even returned once again for 2 days before heading home. Ooookay where to start.....
so first of all.... THE SCENERY! Wide Open spaces all around! You'll drive down a long dirt road (cause who doesn't love that!!!) and then BAM! THIS big, beautiful white house!!!
It's just stunning! The landscaping and pebble-lined walkway just give you that feeling that you're about to encounter something special!
OPEN THE DOOR.... Beautiful decor! I MEAN GORGEOUS! Huge OPEN floor plan and the most BEAUTIFUL KITCHEN stocked with EVERYTHING one would need to cook the perfect meal! The BACK YARD would probably be my favorite! HUMONGOUS FIRE-PIT beyond the beautifully paved patio! AND A BIG SCREEN TV ! OUTSIDE! This place is just SO SO special. I could go on! PLEASE CHECK IT OUT! You will not be disappointed!!!!!!

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
You definitely want to book here!
I can't speak highly enough of this place. We absolutely loved our stay here. Everything was clean, there was every amenity we needed, there was a super cozy living room, there were board games and WiFi, and a grill and fire pit outback (and even a dart board and a huge TV!). It was the perfect place to spend our afternoon/evening. I'd even rent this place to literally just hang out there for the weekend as a getaway from home.
The only "cons" were the beds- the spring mattresses had us tossing and turning, but I wouldn't let that stop me from going back. Maybe I'd bring my mattress topper and my own pillows or something. I also wasn't a fan of the Betta bowl on the counter; I've been a pet care provider for about 12 years and I always hate to see pets with outdated care (Betta's need full tanks and filters like every other fish!).
All that being said, I would return here a million times as a halfway point to spend time with my parents!

review_text: Great little big little getaway, the full moon and the starts are amazing, while sitting next to the warmth of the fire pit. This little house is beautifully decorated with Western and Country theme with a touch of industrial. We felt at home the minute we arrived. The details in the home gave the perfect finishing touch. Keep in mind that the house is about 70 ft off of the road so you will have cars passing by, and if you are staying on a weekend during hunting season, there is a group of hunters that will park across the street to hunt in the hunting club land near by. We went to a local barbecue place, brought it back and enjoyed dinner around the fire pit. Some may think that the price point after additional fees might be a bit high but the house is immaculately decorated and it's a perfect seclusion getaway, and if that's what matters to you then this place is perfect! The only thing missing is a hot tub to soak in under the stars.

I was setting up a cozy bon fire to enjoy breakfast around. I saw fisherman on the lake as the steam fog engulfed their surroundings. I got beautiful pictures! The house was very tidy and cozy. We will keep this place on our list to revisit in the future.

review_text: Overall the stay was fine. It was supposed to be my husband, daughter and I for a work event he had going on, but I ended up having something come up so it was just him. He arrived a little early so I messaged to see if he could check in, I also sent the photos of the exterior damage like Gavin had asked. I never got a response from anyone. I got automated messages about check out towards the end of the stay, but never did I get a message from someone on the other end. The stay itself was fine he said other than the house could use a mirror downstairs as well and that it is not very private- very out in the open, but otherwise it was fine. Glad he didnâ€™t have any issues since we were unable to reach the host. As a host myself, I try to be very responsive to guests knowing that this is an important aspect of the hosting process.

review_text: House was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed for a short stay. Check-in was easy. Gavin provided lots of helpful information. Loved that the place was pet friendly, and the grassy area outside was perfect for our dog to run around. This was the first airbnb I've stayed at (and there have been many) that provided paper plates and plastic utensils instead of actual dishware. I think having coffee mugs, plates, wine glasses, etc. (and also a sponge, dish soap, and a kitchen towel to help keep the place clean) would greatly enhance the experience. Also, I found the kitchenette area and the shower to be quite dark. Other than that, the place worked out well for an overnight stay, and I would book again if I'm in the area!

Our son left his bag and Gavin was great about letting us know and arranging for us to get the bag back. We did not bring our dog this trip but will in the future. The place was pet friendly but did not smell like it was a home with pets. The home has one bathroom which worked for 3 males and a female. We will definitely stay again! Do try the new Mexican restaurant just down the street. The steak asada fries were delicious and it stays open until 10! Great place, great host.

Stayed over a week
review_text: The Suite Retreat was a very cozy and quiet stay in the quaint town of Littleton. I enjoyed the cleanliness, the wood floors, the simple style of furnishing, the fluffy towels, and big back yard and deck. If you are staying long, bring a hotplate or a grill. As well as pots and pans, plates and bowls, spatulas, serving spoons etc. And if you don't like to cook, don't fret bc there are a couple nice restaurants within 1 minute of driving/3 minute walk. The restaurants have bubbly staff and everyone I met in Littleton treated me like a friendly neighbor. This area has a very special local history so go out, meet the locals, and enjoy the upcoming lake season!

I especially loved that our dogs were welcome at this location.

Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: After some 30 Airbnbs during the past two years, the Suite Retreat is the first Airbnb where we had no concern about Covid. The entire unit is immaculately clean and the use of high quality disposable utensils, including coffee cups and dishes, minimizes the risk of transmitting bacteria. Sanitizing products, including, wipes and hand cleaners, are also readily available. Not only did the unit exceed our discriminating standards for cleanliness, but everything else was five star - including high end comfortable beds and furniture and fluffy towels. Finally, the unit is easy to find and in a quiet area. Our host was great - very accommodating and attentive to our needs. We know Super Hosts work hard to achieve their rating and we appreciated the personal attention, such as texts to inform us of places to eat and shop. Way to go Gavin! Thanks for making your rental available to us. Ray and Debby

A very comfortable Queen bed for our Fri-Sun  stay.  Leslie's  prompt messaging was impressive, esp. learning of family funeral Sat.
So, didnt  alert him of other concerns- none he could resolve then,anyway.
As Airbnb hosts & as guests ourselves, below reflects OUR  PREFERENCES for guests' ease/comfort. Most future guests may find L's house meets their needs.Others may benefit from our notes BELOW:
No guest guide for suggestions, 'where stuff is', POI, use of roku/appliances.   
the  2023  reviews  re: unfinished queen room/full bath still unresolved. A work-in-progess, as is the pleated plastic ill sliding door to bedr; +both toilet seats wobble.
a syrupy overpowering  scent.  Found/removed plug-ins in each room, opened doors;still evident when we left 
 
Old clumped leaves/oak 'worms' covered deck/furniture, despite brisk winds.
L-room lacks lamps  at either end of either of the two sofas. Only overhead-same w/ kitchen/dining table.Soft lighting more inviting!

review_text: The house is in a quiet and safe-feeling neighborhood. There is a large fenced-in backyard that would be great if you're traveling with dogs. You can tell that a lot of work was put into this house, but like other reviewers have said it feels a little unfinished. Especially the back bedroom. For example, the paint job is really splotchy and there is no baseboard / floor moulding so you can see the space between the wall and the floor. There were a few other minor things like that. Those things aside, the hosts did a great job decorating and the bed was comfy and clean. A tip for the door lock keypad: First press the bottom right area where the # sign is and the keypad will light up. then type in your code and press # again.

review_text:
I canâ€™t say enough good things about this charming cabin cottage. Donâ€™t hesitate to book it! We were driving from south Florida to NWPA and booked it very last minute with our dogs, because we were initially just going to stay at a hotel overnight, but after 12 hours in the car, we wanted our dogs to be able to stretch their legs and run a bit off lead. This home was perfect! The back porch was so charming and the swing was comfy. I only wish we couldâ€™ve stayed longer.
We got in at 8pm and left by 6am, but the dogs had a blast doing zoomies in the sizable living space and outside, before going to bed. When I had a question, I felt bad texting after 8pm, but they got back to me right away without hesitation. If Iâ€™m ever in that part of Virginia for a couple of days, I hope to stay there again. Itâ€™s simply lovely. Thank you for letting us stay!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Jessica and David's place is a hidden gem. We arrived at night, so it was dark as we drove off 95 toward's their cabin. When we woke up we found it quiet and tucked away near the local church. There wasn't any neighbors within view so we had our privacy. Our pup (which Jessica and David allowed) had a fun sniffari in the backyard. The cabin is great for a family with two huge beds side by side and a large open area to lounge around in and chat. We would stop and stay here again if the need arose.
